text.p: These are the leading stories in the Angolan press on Tuesday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Angolan prime minister Franca Can-Vandunem said that the country had plenty of food stockpiled for the coming year.

- The ministry of foreign relations has sent a delegation to Eastern Europe led by vice-minister of foreign relations Sebastiao Isata with the purpose of expanding co-operation between Angola and that region. He spent 48 hours in Yugoslavia and is currently in the Romanian capital of Bucharest.
- Governor of Luanda province Justino Fernandes accused Unita of obstructing the formation of the Government of Unity and National Reconcilitaion.
